intro: Seseli serpentina, commonly known as serpent's head, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Seseli serpentina is often found in meadows and rocky areas, and it is known for its delicate appearance and medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
